intro: Eupteron nodosum, commonly known as the nodding euperteron, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, nodding flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
